title: How to See if Someone Read Your Text on Samsung Galaxy

steps.title: Open the Messages app on your Galaxy.
steps.content: Open the Messages app on your Galaxy. You’ll usually find it on the home screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ⁝.
steps.content: Tap ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. A menu will expand. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It’s at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap More Settings.
steps.content: Tap More Settings . It’s near the bottom of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Text messages.
steps.content: Tap Text messages . It’s at the top of the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the “Delivery reports” to the On position.
steps.content: Slide the “Delivery reports” to the On position. This ensures you get a delivery report for each text message you send. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the back button.
steps.content: Tap the back button. This brings you back to the menu.

steps.title: Tap Multimedia messages.
steps.content: Tap Multimedia messages . It’s the second option in the menu.

steps.title: Slide the “Delivery reports” to the On position.
steps.content: Slide the “Delivery reports” to the On position.

steps.title: Slide the “Read reports” switch to the On position.
steps.content: Slide the “Read reports” switch to the On position. As long as the person you’re messaging has this setting enabled in their app, you’ll be notified when they read your message.
